name: Unordered List
content:
# Unordered List

This tag is used to create  a set of bulleted items.  An unordered list element has the tag `<ul>`. This is an abbreviation for Unordered List. Each item in the list is marked by a list item element `<li>`.

examples.name: Unordered List
examples.description: Using `<ul>` to make an unordered list

examples.name: Boba Flavors
examples.description: A list of possible flavors to include in boba tea.

short_description:
Unordered List
This tag is used to create  a set of bulleted items.  An unordered list element has the tag <ul>. This is an abbreviation for Unordered List. Each item in the list is marked by a list item element <li>.
tips:
* To make the unordered list, write the unordered list tags `
`. Next, add your list items inside the unordered list tags. To make each list item, use the list item tags `
    • ` and write the list item inside the tags. * Try to indent your `` tags so it's clear they are contained in the `
      ` tag. * The list items can contain content other than text such as lists of videos, images, songs, or hyperlinks.
